Simulated microdata: Germany (German PPS)

Source: R/bhai_cases_de.R
bhai_cases_de.Rd

Case-level simulated microdata for age/sex analyses of HAI burden in Germany. Each row represents a simulated case with a sampling weight so that weighted sums reproduce the published totals (within uncertainty).

Usage

bhai_cases_de

Format

A data frame with columns:

hai

character. HAI type (HAP, UTI, BSI, SSI, CDI).

age_group

character. Age band: "0-1", "2-4", ..., "85+".

sex

character. "Female" or "Male".

death

integer. 1 if death occurred, 0 otherwise.

yll

numeric. Years of life lost for this case (0 if death == 0).

yld

numeric. Years lived with disability for this case.

daly

numeric. yll + yld.

weight

numeric. Case weight to scale up to population totals.

Source

Zacher et al. (2019) Eurosurveillance. doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135

Details

These microdata are simulated for teaching/demo from published totals and rates; they are not real patient-level records. For authoritative numbers and figures, consult the Eurosurveillance article.

Examples

data("bhai_cases_de", package = "BHAIBYE")
# Recreate weighted totals of DALYs by age group
if (requireNamespace("dplyr", quietly = TRUE)) {
  dplyr::summarise(
    dplyr::group_by(bhai_cases_de, age_group),
    dalys_weighted = sum(daly * weight)
  )
}
#> # A tibble: 14 × 2
#>    age_group dalys_weighted
#>    <chr>              <dbl>
#>  1 0-1                4545.
#>  2 10-14              1826.
#>  3 15-19              7643.
#>  4 2-4                5253.
#>  5 20-24              8496.
#>  6 25-34              5133.
#>  7 35-44             10655.
#>  8 45-54             10906.
#>  9 5-9                8125.
#> 10 55-64             35399.
#> 11 65-74             32945.
#> 12 75-79             35722.
#> 13 80-84             41080.
#> 14 85+               57302.
